definition: can't persuade/unable to make (sb) change their mind/unable to resist (sb)
to bend in two so as to break/to defy/to disobey/also pr. [ao3]
stubborn/obstinate
variant of 拗[ao4]
(negative prefix)/not/no
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
(experienced action marker)

sentences.english: The mother give in and bought a toy for her child.
sentences.chinese: 拗不过孩子的要求，母亲买了玩具给他。

sentences.english: No points destined eventually fail to beat you and I fiddle with fate.
sentences.chinese: 有缘无分的你我终究拗不过命运的拨弄。

sentences.english: His mother gave in and bought him a new bike.
sentences.chinese: 他母亲拗不过他，只得给他买了一辆新自行车。

sentences.english: Xu Chan urged millions of millions of travel together, Ao however had promised.
sentences.chinese: 徐婵怂恿百万一同出游，百万拗不过只好答应。

sentences.english: But the identity of the man matters less than the persistence of the legend.
sentences.chinese: 但这人的真实身份拗不过传奇的力量。

sentences.english: Du Du Ao however right to move to the right, temporarily staying.
sentences.chinese: 杜杜拗不过权来，暂时搬走去权家暂住。

definition: to try one's very best to persuade sb (idiom)/to reason with sb in every way possible
to coax and pester (idiom)/to wheedle/to cajole
to implore/to plead/to ask earnestly
to drop (subject etc)
without any better option/to have to/to be forced to
to tackle a difficult job (idiom)/to do sth reluctantly
to cajole/to sweet talk sb into doing sth
to be determined to/to insist on
unwilling
to have no alternative/to be helpless
to repel/to decline
to entreat piteously/to implore
to incite
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
to persuade/persuasion/to advise
half willing and half unwilling (idiom); to yield after making a show of resistance
